etymology.description: 艮(艮) (gèn, "stopping") + semantic: 食(食) (shí, "food") = place associated with food -> building, hall
etymology.interpretation: In 馆(館), the component 艮(艮) (gèn, "stopping") acts as the phonetic element, while 食(食) (shí, "food") is the semantic component symbolizing a place related to food, thus forming the meaning of a building or hall, particularly one related to eating or gathering.
etymology.simplification: 馆(館): Radicals simplified with 夂(夂) (zhǐ, "go") replacing 食(飠) for visual simplicity while keeping the overall meaning.

examples.chinese: 我在图书馆(我在圖書館)借阅书籍(借閱書籍)。
examples.english: I borrow books at the library.

examples.chinese: 故宫博物馆(故宮博物館)收藏珍贵文物(收藏珍貴文物)。
examples.english: The Palace Museum collects precious cultural relics.
